data.title: The climate of Zimbabwe and the best time to visit
data.meta_description: Discover the climate of Zimbabwe. Read about average temperatures, rainfall, and the ideal months to visit.
data.text:
What’s the climate like in Zimbabwe?

The current climate in Zimbabwe features temperatures ranging from a high of 36°C to a low of 26°C throughout the year. The average yearly temperature is around 31°C. At night, temperatures in the colder months average around 9°C and in the warmer months around 20°C.

The highest temperature recorded in Zimbabwe in recent years was 40°C in October 2016. The lowest daytime temperature recorded was 18°C in July 2023.

On average, Zimbabwe receives 755 mm of rainfall each year. For comparison, New York gets 862 mm of rainfall annually.

The climate of Zimbabwe is based on weather data from Victoria Falls. Other locations might vary.

Jan Feb Mar Apr May Jun Jul Aug Sep Oct Nov Dec Temp. max (°C) 30 31 31 30 29 26 26 30 34 36 34 32 Rainfall Rainfall (mm) 206 209 99 27 0,7 0,5 0,4 0,1 0,5 9,8 61 141

Click on the month name to see more weather details, like daily averages, temperatures, and precipitation for the past years in that month.

The best time to visit Zimbabwe for sunny weather is March through September and November. During this period, you'll have good temperatures and not too much rain, making it a great time to visit Zimbabwe. In the other months of the year, there's too much rain or the temperature isn't ideal for a visit if you want sunny and pleasant weather.

Climate Table of Zimbabwe

The climate table of Zimbabwe shows the average temperatures, rainfall, and UV index per month. The table gives an overview of the average day and night temperatures in degrees Celsius, the total amount of rainfall in millimetres, the total snowfall in centimetres, and the UV index for each month. Rainfall is always measured as water, even if it's snow or hail.

Jan Feb Mar Apr May Jun Jul Aug Sep Oct Nov Dec Temp. max (°C) 30 31 31 30 29 26 26 30 34 36 34 32 Temp. min (°C) 20 19 19 16 12 10 9 12 17 20 21 20 Rainfall Rainfall (mm) 206 209 99 27 0,7 0,5 0,4 0,1 0,5 9,8 61 141 UV Index 8 8 8 8 8 8 8 9 10 10 9 9

Click on the month name to see more weather details, like daily averages, temperatures, and precipitation for the past years in that month.

Average yearly temperature: 31°C

Highest temperature: 36°C in October

Lowest temperature: 26°C in June and July

Precipitation: 755 mm per year, averaging 63 mm per month

Driest months: 0,1 mm in August, 0,4 mm in July and 0,5 mm in June

Wettest months: 209 mm in February, 206 mm in January and 141 mm in December

Average Temperature per Month in Zimbabwe

This graph shows the average maximum temperatures per month in Zimbabwe. The temperatures are shown in degrees Celsius and the average is calculated based on the recorded temperatures per month from past years.

Average Rainfall per Month in Zimbabwe

This graph shows how much rainfall Zimbabwe gets on average per month. Rainfall is always measured as water, even if it's snow or hail. This makes it easy to compare how much has fallen, regardless of the form of precipitation. The amount of rainfall is measured in millimetres and the average is calculated based on the recorded rainfall per month from past years.

Average UV Index per Month in Zimbabwe

This graph shows the average UV index per month in Zimbabwe. The UV index indicates the intensity of ultraviolet radiation and ranges from 0 to a maximum of 11.

Yearly Temperature in Zimbabwe

This graph shows the average yearly temperature in Zimbabwe. The yearly temperature, expressed in degrees Celsius, is the average of all twelve monthly temperatures summed up for that year.

Total Yearly Rainfall in Zimbabwe

This chart shows the total yearly rainfall in Zimbabwe over the past few years. The total yearly rainfall, measured in centimetres, is the sum of all the rain that fell in the twelve months of that year.
